page.title: 01The area - a gazetteer
page.content: The area covered by Walgrave County Primary School is approximately 10 miles to the North East of Northampton.It is a rural area mostly given over to arable crops.Lying on the Northamptonshire uplands it is the epitome of the rolling English Countryside.There are two villages, Walgrave and Hannington, with about 700 and 150 inhabitants respectively. Children of primary age go to the local school in Walgrave ,those of secondary age ,by and large, go to Moulton Comprehensive or Kettering. Most people living in the village work out of the area.The local employment consists of either farming or the belt factory in Walgrave. Most of the homes are built of Northamptonshire Ironstone and roofed with tiles.Houses are continuing to be built in both villages.
